Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2008 05:25PM lag wrote: I had my first mamogram done at 37, (thats four years ago) and thank god I did, because that is where and when they found my BC. the tumor was 5cm. I dont mean for this to scare anyone, but the sooner you have those tests (mamogram) done the better chance tht there is to catch something earlier on. lag

Posts.Content: lag wrote: Just wondering if anyone else is a clerk at a convienence store? After my recent surgery I am realizing that the majority of the duties throughout the day are going to  cause me lots of pain-my ps has prescribed pain meds and am being put on anxiety meds as well but dont know what my options are as far as work goes? I have weight as well as movement limitations and am afraid of being ridiculed- i need the $ -if not i would quit in a heartbeat-help! Posts.Title: work lag lag

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2008 11:09PM lag wrote: tonight my fiance and i went out for dinner in town with friends of ours , upon entrance into the place it was hard to see because of the glare from snow outside-so anyay we go sit down and eat our meals and afterwards are getting ready to leave, sitting at a table next to the door happens to be a gal that i work with (i work at a convienence store), well she wouldnt say one word to me at all but talked up a storm to the friend i was with---this hurts because two weeks ago I had surgery and things didnt go as i thought they would ( i thought my surgery was a one time surgery-implant removal and replacement)-thought i'd be off for the most a week or two-well turns out ps had to put an expander in instead of another implant)so i am back to square one with expansion. problem now is that i need to go see ps every other week for expantion i need more time off (my ps is 2 1/2 hours away-so thats at least 5 hours in drive time (i live in a town of 200 people). . i dont feel so well the day of and after expantion and bagging peoples groceries, and stocking shelves is not going to feel good either. Tonight i felt like such an out cast-i didnt ask for bc-why would she be like that-what did i do wrong-i am crying and shaking-this is not FAIR...!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2008 09:44AM lag wrote: Thank you Ann for the information. I work in a very small place (just a small town gas station store) so there is no sick time allowed and as of yet I have not asked for the vacation pay that I have coming to me -I'm trying not to until I absolutely need it, my way of thinking that I am still employed (because they owe me $$$) I did sacrifice myself for them the first time through surgery and that is why I am going through surgery again so no I do not intend to make it any easier for them-why should I. The weather is getting somuch nicer and I keep laughing knowing that they have to all be inside while I CAN go outside and enjoy it and have docs permission to do so--ha ha ha lag
